CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: A new series of donor - acceptor ( D-A ) conjugated random terpolymers ( PBDTT-DPP-TPD ) were synthesized from electron - rich thienyl-substituted benzo[1,2b:4,5-b′]dithiophene ( BDTT ) , in conjugation with two electron - deficient units , pyrrolo [3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-dione ( DPP ) and thieno [3,4-c]pyrrole-4,6-dione ( TPD ) , of different electron - withdrawing strengths.

Let's think step by step.

1. Electron-rich thienyl-substituted benzo[1,2b:4,5-b′]dithiophene (BDTT)
2. Pyrrolo [3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-dione (DPP)
3. Thieno [3,4-c]pyrrole-4,6-dione (TPD)

These are the Material Name entities mentioned in the paragraph. They are the specific types of conjugated units used in the synthesis of the new series of donor-acceptor (D-A) conjugated random terpolymers.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. BDTT (thienyl-substituted benzo[1,2b:4,5-b′]dithiophene)
2. DPP (pyrrolo [3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-dione)
3. TPD (thieno [3,4-c]pyrrole-4,6-dione)

These are the entities that clearly refer to Material Names mentioned in the paragraph. They are the specific types of electron-rich and electron-deficient units used in the synthesis of the new series of donor-acceptor (D-A) conjugated random terpolymers.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| thienyl-substituted benzo[1,2b:4,5-b′]dithiophene (BDTT) |
| pyrrolo [3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-dione (DPP) |
| thieno [3,4-c]pyrrole-4,6-dione (TPD) |

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: A new series of donor - acceptor ( D-A ) conjugated random terpolymers ( PBDTT-DPP-TPD ) were synthesized from electron - rich thienyl-substituted benzo[1,2b:4,5-b′]dithiophene ( BDTT ) , in conjugation with two electron - deficient units , pyrrolo [3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-dione ( DPP ) and thieno [3,4-c]pyrrole-4,6-dione ( TPD ) , of different electron - withdrawing strengths.

Let's think step by step.

1. PBDTT: This is a terpolymer with the repeating units being electron-rich thienyl-substituted benzo[1,2b:4,5-b′]dithiophene (BDTT).
2. D-A: This is a general term for a type of conjugated polymer where there are donor (electron-rich) and acceptor (electron-deficient) units.
3. PBDTT-DPP: This is a specific type of donor-acceptor terpolymer, where one of the acceptor units is pyrrolo [3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-dione (DPP).
4. TPD: This is a specific type of electron-deficient unit, thieno [3,4-c]pyrrole-4,6-dione (TPD).
5. BDTT: This is an electron-rich monomer, benzo[1,2b:4,5-b′]dithiophene.
6. DPP: This is an electron-deficient monomer, pyrrolo [3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-dione.
7. TPD: This is another electron-deficient monomer, thieno [3,4-c]pyrrole-4,6-dione.

So, the Property Names in the paragraph are:

1. PBDTT-DPP-TPD: A type of donor-acceptor terpolymer.
2. BDTT: An electron-rich monomer.
3. DPP: An electron-deficient monomer.
4. TPD: An electron-deficient monomer.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

1. PBDTT-DPP-TPD: A type of donor-acceptor terpolymer.

This is the only entity in the paragraph that clearly refers to a material property, as it describes a specific type of polymer with donor and acceptor units.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| PBDTT-DPP-TPD (A new series of donor-acceptor (D-A) terpolymers with the repeating units being electron-rich thienyl-substituted benzo[1,2b:4,5-b′]dithiophene (BDTT) in conjugation with two electron-deficient units, pyrrolo [3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-dione (DPP) and thieno [3,4-c]pyrrole-4,6-dione (TPD) of different electron-withdrawing strengths) |

3. Electron-deficient unit thieno [3,4-c]pyrrole-4,6-dione (TPD)

1. Electron-deficient unit pyrrolo [3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-dione (DPP)
2. Electron-deficient unit thieno [3,4-c]pyrrole-4,6-dione (TPD)

These entities are the only ones that clearly refer to the material properties (electron-withdrawing strength) mentioned in the paragraph.
